Diabetes.information: Diabetes is a chronic condition that occurs when the body cannot effectively use insulin.
tests:
Fasting blood glucose test
1. Normal: 99 mg/dL or below
2. Prediabetes: 100-125 mg/dL
3. Diabetes: 126 mg/dL or above

Hemoglobin A1c test
1. Normal: below 5.7% (below 100 mg/dL)
2. Prediabetes: 5.7% to 6.4% (100 to 125 mg/dL)
3. Diabetes: 6.5% or higher (126 mg/dL or higher)

Hypertension.information: Hypertension is a condition in which the blood pressure in the arteries is persistently elevated.

Asthma.information: Asthma is a condition in which your airways narrow and swell and may produce extra mucus.

Arthritis.information: Arthritis is a term often used to mean any disorder that affects joints. Arthritis is extremely common, especially in people older than 50. It causes joint pain, stiffness and inflammation.

Pneumonia.prescription: Azithromycin 500mg on day 1, then 250mg daily for 4 days.
Pneumonia.information: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid or pus.

Gastroenteritis.information: Gastroenteritis is an inflammation of the stomach and intestines, usually due to a viral infection.

Flu.information: The flu is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.

COVID-19.prescription: Remdesivir 200mg on day 1, then 100mg daily for 4 days.
COVID-19.information: COVID-19 is an infectious disease caused by the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2.

Influenza.information: Influenza is a viral infection that attacks your respiratory system.

Infectious Disease.information: Infectious diseases are disorders caused by organisms such as bacteria, viruses, fungi or parasites.

Heart Disease.information: Heart disease refers to various types of conditions that affect the heart.

Kidney Disease.information: Kidney disease refers to a range of conditions that affect kidney function.

Liver Disease.information: Liver disease refers to any condition that impairs liver function.

Malaria.information: Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease caused by parasitic protozoans.

Tuberculosis.information: Tuberculosis (TB) is a potentially serious infectious disease that mainly affects the lungs.

Measles.information: Measles is a highly contagious viral disease that causes fever, cough, and a characteristic rash.

HIV.information: HIV is a virus that attacks the body's immune system, specifically the CD4 cells (T cells).

Hepatitis.information: Hepatitis is an inflammation of the liver, often caused by a viral infection.

Cancer.information: Cancer is a disease in which abnormal cells divide without control and can invade nearby tissues.

Chickenpox.prescription: Acyclovir 800mg five times a day for 7 days.
Chickenpox.information: Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection characterized by an itchy rash and flu-like symptoms.

Depression.information: Depression is a mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest.

Anxiety.information: Anxiety disorders are a group of mental health disorders characterized by excessive fear or worry.

Bipolar Disorder.information: Bipolar disorder is a mental health condition that causes extreme mood swings that include emotional highs (mania or hypomania) and lows (depression).

Migraine.information: Migraine is a neurological condition characterized by recurrent, severe headaches often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light and sound.
